# App Icon — Single Source of Truth

## Source File
**`src/assets/app-icon.png`** (1024×1024, PNG, square, no transparency, no baked-in rounded corners)

This file is the ONE canonical icon. All other icon files are derived from it.

## Derived Files (auto-generated or copied)

| File | Purpose | Size |
|------|---------|------|
| `public/icon-192.png` | PWA manifest icon | 192×192 (scaled from source) |
| `public/icon-512.png` | PWA manifest icon | 512×512 (scaled from source) |
| `public/apple-touch-icon.png` | iOS Safari home screen | 180×180 (scaled from source) |
| `public/favicon.ico` | Browser tab | 32×32 |

## Native Builds (Capacitor)

Run `npm run cap:icons` or `bash scripts/generate-assets.sh` to auto-generate all iOS/Android icon sizes from the source file via `@capacitor/assets`.

### Apple App Store
- 1024×1024 PNG, no transparency, no rounded corners
- iOS applies its own superellipse mask automatically
- Referenced in `capacitor.assets.json` → `ios.icon`

### Google Play Store
- 512×512 PNG for store listing
- Adaptive icon layers generated by `@capacitor/assets`
- Referenced in `capacitor.assets.json` → `android.icon`

## Rules
1. **Never bake rounded corners** into the source icon — platforms apply their own masks
2. **No transparency** — Apple rejects icons with alpha channels
3. **No text** — must be legible at 29×29pt
4. **Update process**: Replace `src/assets/app-icon.png` → run `scripts/generate-assets.sh` → `npx cap sync`
